inclusion.criterion: approximately 1-2 weeks prior to her expected date of follow up
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: conversation and invited to participate in the study
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: interviewed by the clinical research nurse using the format of the prepared proforma (Form A)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: records her impression of whether the patient has worrisome symptoms of disease or not and has symptoms of treatment toxicity or not for which she should visit the hospital
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: the examining physician then takes a complete history and in addition, performs a physical examination and any investigations he/she deems necessary
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Following this he/she notes down final impression of disease status and toxicity which are taken as the gold standard (Form B)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Each patient will be interviewed only once during their follow up schedule
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: In addition at the physical visit, information regarding the acceptability of nurse-led telephonic follow-up to the patient and the financial impact of physical follow- up will be collected using a structured format (Form C)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Study participant drop-out/ Lost-to-follow up: Patients may withdraw their consent at any point during the telephonic interview or the subsequent follow up visit
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: A patient who does not attend the scheduled follow up visit within 1-2 weeks of the telephonic interview will be called a second time to remind her of the follow up appointment and enquire about reasons for non-attendance in the clinic, which will be recorded
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: If patient does not report to the clinic within the next 2 weeks, she will be considered to have dropped out from the study
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Those patients in whom the interval between telephonic interview and the physician's assessment is more than 4 weeks, will be considered drop outs and follow up telephone call will go out to enquire about reasons for non-attendance in the clinic, which will be recorded
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Cervical Cancer Stage Ib2, II and III (Squamous carcinoma or adenocarcinoma)
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Patients with Stage III disease treated with palliative intent with once monthly radiotherapy
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Early stage cervical cancer patients who underwent Wertheims hysterectomy and who have completed adjuvant radiochemotherapy due to high-risk factors
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Patients who are unable to comprehend the questions or dialogue over telephone by medical staff.
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Patients who seem unreliable for follow up
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: A 67-year-old healthy woman with no underlying disease, menopausal and has 4 children. She takes daily multivitamins and anti-hypertensive drugs.
